title: remove vertical lines in replies
content:
Hi: I'm trying to find some way of removing the vertical lines on the left margin in front of quoted text in replies. A previous asking of this same question lead me to attempt to install the 'replywithheader' add-on but it hangs with the "Add ReplyWithHeader? This extension will have permission to: .... Cancel Add" popup box ... It doesn't matter if I click either Cancel or Add, the box just hangs there. Or is there some other way of removing the vertical lines? One might have thought this would be an easily accessible option in the setup.

Thing is that I'm working on a rather long report with other people and we email changes back and forth but each time another vertical line is added. How to nuke ALL the vertical lines? How to stop them from being added in the first place?

I understand that what displays as vertical line is really a '>' character in the actual text of the message. If I could figure out where the actual messages are stored I could maybe just delete the '>' characters, perhaps?
creator: rayandrews

title: Email problem
content:
Hi, I recently set up a Thunderbird email account ([edited] @fultoncooper.com) and received a few emails but then I got this 'bounceback' message when I sent myself a message from my Hotmail account:

No connection could be made because the target computer actively refused it. This usually results from trying to connect to a service that is inactive on the remote host - that is, one with no server application running. For more information and tips to fix this issue see this article: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=389361

I do not understand the article mentioned. Please could someone help me so that I can receive emails again?

Thanks, Graham Cooper

title: Sending gpg encrypted message with Attached public key, the recipient gets error stating opengpg message currupted
content:
When sending an encrypted message, if I have End to end encryption --> Advanced Setting --> Attach my public key... checked, I get error message that tells me message is corrupted by MS-Exchange. As far as I am aware I don't go through MS exchange. The message is sent from a protonmail address and received in a gmail address. Both sender and recipient are on the same desktop system running Thunderbird 102.7.1 (64-bit) on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS.

If I click repair, then the message content is finally displayed. I get not get an error when I unclick the attach my public key... box.

I don't know what message, if any, the recipient will see if using Outlook or webmail.

Thanks,
creator: joe9999

title: can't get any new emails on thunderbird
content: since around Feb 9 I haven't been able to get any new emails downloaded on my new laptop. It worked OK for the first two weeks after I set it up, and then stopped. Now it just continues to load old messages that were previously deleted multiple times, and I get this message when I click on "get new messages" - "the account jquinn@wxxxxx.net is being processed. Please wait until processing is complete to get new messages" Well, that's been over a month now, and I am about to find something else for emails. I've used Thunderbird for maybe 7 years now, and this is the first really serious problem I've had with it. And I didn't change anything on the laptop. At least I can access my emails on my ipad, or through the internet provider website. Although its a pain and there is bigger hassle.
creator: jquinn2

title: Thunderbird Missing 'Disk Space' And / Or 'Synchronization & Storage' Settings
content:
I'm banging away at this like The Doctor and Azbantium. Here's the situation: Customer has Mozilla Thunderbird and recently "something" has changed and now it is continually downloading everything non-stop from the mail server. The emails just keep coming. I have tried everything

  • Checked all the settings, couldn't find any relevant settings
  • Changed the "mail.server.default.autosync_max_age_days" flag to 2, no difference
  • Tried repairing the inbox folder
  • Uninstalled and re-installed x64 version, was running the 32-bit version
  • Installed Thunderbird on a fresh Windows 10 VM, copied the AppData Local & Roaming folders back, in case it was a program or something on her computer conflicting
  • In the Windows 10 VM, I uninstalled Thunderbird and deleted all the relevant folders. I re-installed it and just added the account from scratch, same thing.

This is what's weird. I use Thunderbird myself but the portable version. With my Thunderbird, under account settings, there's 'Synchronization & Storage' options. Both are the same version number, both x64. Why does one have that setting and the other doesn't? I need the Synchronization & Storage options to fix the problem with my customer's Thunderbird.
creator: mike.soccio
